Subject: activate in C++ version vs. JNeat
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=92207196
X-Yahoo-Profile: ReubGR

Hello,

I just ported the Single pole balancing code from the C++ version to 
JNeat.

I'm using the pole1startgenes from the C++ version and the parameters 
I'm using are in p2test.ne

So far I've evolved for 123 generations (pop = 1000) and the fitness is 
only at 602 (that is, the pole stays up for 602 time steps).

This seems strange because Ken's thesis says he was able to do double 
pole balancing in 24 generations. Hmm...

Do any of you know if the activate function in the JNeat version is 
different than activate in Ken's C++ version? In some places in the 
JNeat version, activate is called for 1+networkDepth times. Does 
activate in Ken's version propagate new vals all the way from input to 
output?

Any help would be appreciated.

Thanks,
Reuben
